list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The ball rebounded off the wall.

list_ex_of_english: In 34 games, he averaged 14.8 points, 8.0 rebounds, 2.1 assists and 1.1 blocks in 29.2 minutes per game.
Throughout the event he accumulated averages of 8 points and 6 rebounds per game.
He sent my letter down to the commissars in the engine room, from whence it rebounded smartly with a memorandum attached.
He improved his regular season statistics significantly, averaging 15.5 points per game (ppg), 5.3 assists per game (apg) and 2.6 rebounds per game (rpg).
He was third in the league in rebounding in 1952-53, with 920.
His numbers continued to increase as a senior; he averaged 28.5 points and eight rebounds.
Gains in the countryside have already rebounded on the cities.
He spoke of water table rebounds, of iron pyrites, of adits—a horizontal or near-horizontal tunnel from the surface into a mine for entry, drainage or exploration.
